text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that goods from third countries to Northern Ireland, if it can be proven that the goods are intended to remain in Northern Ireland, are only subject to the UK tariff rate. The candidate answer states: \"Third-country goods (e.g., from China): If entering NI directly (e.g., via Belfast port), they are presumed 'at risk' (since they could enter the EU via Ireland). Exception: If the importer can prove the goods are only for NI consumption, they may qualify for Green Lane treatment.\" The Green Lane treatment implies minimal checks and application of the UK tariff rate (as opposed to the EU tariff rate applied in the Red Lane). This directly addresses the condition and outcome specified in the criterion.", "criterion_id": "31ba07bc-6e8b-4a21-b24c-b747c1641530"}
